QicsCheckCellDisplay Class Reference

#include <QicsCheckCellDisplay.h>

Inheritance diagram for QicsCheckCellDisplay:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

QicsCheckCellDisplay is a cell displayer for QicsTable that displays check boxes in cells. This cell display class is different from QicsTextCellDisplay in that QicsCheckCellDisplay inherits from both QicsMovableEntryWidgetCellDisplay and QCheckBox. This means that the displayer object is also a check box. This allows the programmer to easily use any QCheckBox method or modify any QCheckBox property.

The check box state of a cell is determined by the method checkState(). The default implementation of this method is a no-op -- it always returns true. This is because it is not feasible for QicsCheckCellDisplay to be able to map from arbitrary values in the data model to a boolean value. Instead, programmers that want to display check boxes should subclass QicsCheckCellDisplay and reimplement this method so that it correctly maps between data model values and the check box's state.

The text that is displayed in the cell is determined by the method textToDisplay(). The default implementation of this method returns the value of the ::label label property for the cell. This method may be reimplemented in a subclass by the programmer.

The pixmap that is displayed in the cell is determined by the method pixmapToDisplay(). The default implementation of this method returns the value of the ::pixmap pixmap property for the cell. This method may be reimplemented in a subclass by the programmer.

When the check box state of a cell is changed by the user, the valueChanged() method is called. The default implementation of this method is a no-op -- it does nothing. This is because it is not feasible for QicsCheckCellDisplay to determine the appropriate course of action. Programmers should subclass QicsCheckCellDisplay and reimplement this method to achieve the desired behavior.

virtual QColorGroup QicsCellDisplay::cellColorGroup (  QicsGridInfo *  info,
int  row,
int  col,
bool  for_printer = false
)  [protected, virtual, inherited]
 

Returns the colorgroup to be used when drawing in cell (row, col ), using grid information from info. If for_printer is true, the colorgroup will have a white background color substituted for any background colors that are the same as the default background color of the grid.

Parameters:
info grid info object
row the row in visual coordinates
col the column in visual coordinates
for_printer will this color group be used to print?

virtual bool QicsCheckCellDisplay::checkState (  QicsGridInfo *  info,
int  row,
int  col,
int  model_row,
int  model_col,
const QicsDataItem *  itm
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the check box state for cell (row, col ).

This default method always returns false.

This method is intended to be reimplemented by subclasses of QicsCheckCellDisplay. The programmer should implement this method so that it returns the appropriate value for the given cell.

For example, a subclass might implement the following method that sets the check box when the value of the cell is "Y":

 bool MyCheckBoxSubclass::checkState(QicsGridInfo *info, int row, int col)
 {
    QString qs = info->dataModel().getOriginalItem(model_row, model_col)->string();

    return (qs == QString("Y"));
 }

Parameters:
info grid info object
row the visual row index of the cell whose value changed
col the visual column index of the cell whose value changed
model_row the model row index of the cell whose value changed
model_col the model column index of the cell whose value changed
itm the data item for this cell (this value may be 0)

virtual QRect QicsCellDisplay::displayableCellArea (  QicsGridInfo *  ginfo,
int  row,
int  col,
const QRect &  cr_full,
bool  consider_margin = true,
bool  consider_border = true
)  const [protected, virtual, inherited]
 

Returns a rectangle specifying the area of cell (row, col ) that can be used to display information. This rectangle is based on the full area of the cell (contained in cr_full ), minus the area reserved for the cell's border and margin.

Parameters:
info grid info object
row the row in visual coordinates
col the column in visual coordinates
cr_full the full area of the cell
consider_margin should the returned area exclude the margin of the cell?
consider_border should the returned area exclude the border of the cell?

int  row,

)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Handler for keyboard events that occur within cell (row, col ). The handler must return true if the event was handled by the cell displayer (and thus should not be handled by the grid), or false otherwise.

virtual bool QicsCellDisplay::isCellSelected (  QicsGridInfo *  info,
int  row,
int  col
)  [protected, virtual, inherited]
 

Returns true if cell (row, col ) is selected in grids described by info. If the grid(s) are main table grids, this method simply determines if the cell is contained in the current selection list. If the grid(s) are header grids, this method determines if all the cells in the header cell's row or column are selected.

Parameters:
info grid info object
row the row in visual coordinates
col the column in visual coordinates

virtual QPixmap QicsCheckCellDisplay::pixmapToDisplay (  QicsGridInfo *  info,
int  row,
int  col,
int  model_row,
int  model_col,
const QicsDataItem *  itm
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the pixmap for cell (row, col ).

This default method returns the pixmap that was set for this cell via QicsCell::setPixmap , or 0 if no such pixmap exists.

This method is intended to be reimplemented by subclasses of QicsCheckCellDisplay. The programmer should implement this method so that it returns the appropriate value for the given cell. If no pixmap should be displayed, return the null pixmap.

Parameters:
info grid info object
row the visual row index of the cell
col the visual column index of the cell
model_row the model row index of the cell
model_col the model column index of the cell
itm the data item for this cell (this value may be 0)

virtual void QicsCheckCellDisplay::startEdit (  QicsScreenGrid *  ,
int  row,
int  col,
const QicsDataItem *  itm
)  [virtual]
 

Begin an edit operation in cell (row, col ). This method is intended to be used as a "preparation" for an edit operation. It will be called by the grid in response to a user action or a programmatic call. Note that this method does not specify a location in the grid widget for the edit operation to take place. The location will be specified in a subsequent call to moveEdit().

Parameters:
grid the controlling grid
row the row in visual coordinates
col the column in visual coordinates
itm the value to edit. This value may be 0.

Implements QicsCellDisplay.

virtual void QicsCheckCellDisplay::valueChanged (  QicsGridInfo *  info,
int  row,
int  col,
int  model_row,
int  model_col,
bool  set
)  [protected, virtual]
 

This method is called when the checkbox state for cell (row, col ) is changed. The new checkbox state is set.

This method is intended to be reimplemented by subclasses of QicsCheckCellDisplay. The programmer should implement this method so that it performs the appropriate action(s). Possible actions could include setting a new value in the data model or performing some other action based on the state of the checkbox.

Parameters:
info grid info object
row the visual row index of the cell whose value changed
col the visual column index of the cell whose value changed
model_row the model row index of the cell whose value changed
model_col the model column index of the cell whose value changed
set the new state of the checkbox
